l10nHeader.message: It does localization too! (this whole tab is, actually)

l10nProd.message: You are planning to allow localization, right? You have no idea who will be using your extension!

l10nFirstParagraph.message: When the options page loads, elements decorated with data-l10n will automatically be localized!

l10nSecondParagraph.message: If you need more complex localization, you can also define data-l10n-args.

l10nThirdParagraph.message: Message contents are passed right into innerHTML without processing -

l10nButtonsBefore.message: Different types of buttons are handled as well.  <button> elements have their html set:

l10nButtonsBetween.message: while <input type='submit'> and <input type='button'> get their 'value' set (note: no HTML):

l10nExtras.message: You can even set data-l10n on things like th
